website_summaries.verdict: Excellent build quality in these tools. Good range of chisel sizes in a set for handling a variety of jobs.
pros: Quality of wooden handles is very good
Chrome manganese steel in the chisel blades will last a long time
Includes 4 distinct sizes of tools, ranging in blade width from 0.25" to  1.04"
Made by a small European tool manufacturer that receives high marks for build quality
cons: Steel may not be hard enough to precisely hold edge under high-stress jobs

customer_reviews.title: My first set of chisels
customer_reviews.text: 1. Remove lacquer from tiip (lacquer thinner or abrasives or both) 2. Flatten back on my tri hone 3. Sharpen bevel until no material visible between bevel and flattened back 4. Test out disturbingly entertaining sharp edge on some wood 5. Marvel at cutting wood away like it is butter 6. Realize there is no wood left because it's all turned into shavings 7. Optional, put micro bevel on A couple of chips on tips, they sharpen out so no issue. For the money, I am happy.
customer_reviews.author: CALMM

customer_reviews.title: Narex 4 Piece Chisel Set
customer_reviews.text: These Narex chisels are simply amazing. From the moment you handle it, you can feel the heft, balance and quality workmanship of these tools. I previously bought chisels with western-sounding names, only to find they were made in China with very cheap wood handles and poor workmanship. I have since tossed them out. These Narex chisels represent old-world craftsmanship, and with proper care & wooden mallet, will allow you to cut mortises, dovetails and joints on larger pieces of wood nicely. They are suitable for professionals, serious DIYers and woodworkers. I would not hesitate to recommend them for anyone who works with wood.
customer_reviews.author: EarthPlanner

customer_reviews.title: Great chisels for the money
customer_reviews.text: After having used some cheap kobalt/Irwin chisels for a few years, I was eager to try these chisels based on research and reading reviews from various sources. These chisels are so much better than what I’d been using. They’re light, which makes them easier to work with, and they are just the right size. They didn’t arrive ready to use, but I easily had them sharp within a few minutes. I wish they stayed sharper longer, but keeping a strop at the bench has really helped limit the number of times I have to take these to an actual stone. Overall, I’m very pleased with these chisels and am so glad I took the plunge.
customer_reviews.author: Zack Hryndej

customer_reviews.title: I really like these chisels
customer_reviews.text: I really like these chisels. They are the first set of decent chisels I have ever purchased. They weren't razor sharp out of the box, but they seemed to cut pretty well. I used them to cut a 2 inch mortise all the way through a 3.5" thick piece of douglas fir. This is pretty soft wood, so it was fairly easy. I also bought a piece of glass and some 1200 and 2000 grit sandpaper and sharpened these a little part way through that mortise. I could tell a difference after sharpening. They handles seem very strong and the steel is thick enough that it doesn't seem like it will bend. Overall, I'm very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They need sharpening
customer_reviews.text: I found these chisels recommended in a video review and it was made clear there that they would need sharpening so I knew what to expect. The chisels have a solid, quality feel. I was able to do the immediate job that I purchased them for (all my old chisels having gotten rusty during a period of ill health) without sharpening but it wasn't pretty. So it isn't that they won't work as delivered, just that they, like most tools will work much better when well sharpened, which I still need to do.
customer_reviews.author: Fire Escape

customer_reviews.title: Good quality chisels - probably buy more
customer_reviews.text: Quality overall I would consider good. I like the, i believe beech, handles grip feel good. Steel hoop (or top ferrule) and Ferrule seem to be set firm and unlikely to become loose easily. Cutting edge is machined at 25degree angle. On all 4 chiscels the Blade is slightly concaved towards the centerline what makes flattening/sanding quicker when initializing. Sharpened at 25degrees angle and ready to go. Didn’t serious work with them yet besides some testing. Steel according to specs is Rockwell C 59 which should do. Will find out how edge is hold up. Bottom line good chisels for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Woodworker

customer_reviews.title: Chisels sharpen easily and cut wood, for a good price
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a metallurgist and have no way to determine the Rockwell hardness scale of the steel used in these chisels. They seem "softer" than other chisels I use. They sharpen up quicker on diamond sharpening plates. Don't know if they will dull quicker and require more frequent sharpening. Doesn't matter, I'm basically a wood butcher, not a fine woodworker. Like a monkey not knowing difference between a concert grand piano and a child's toy
customer_reviews.author: Ancient Arch

customer_reviews.title: Great First Chisels
customer_reviews.text: My first chisels, so while I don't have much to compare them too, I am a former chef, and and avid swordsman. What I can say is that they are easy to sharpen (meaning fairly soft metal), but seem to hold the edge well. I have been working on my mortise and tenons with them to good success. I considered the Irwin chisels, but reviews mention them being quite hard, which SOUNDS like a good thing, until you try to sharpen something that is really 60+ on the Rockwell scale. It's a pain in the @##.
customer_reviews.author: amanda

customer_reviews.title: Seem good to me
customer_reviews.text: I'm no craftsman woodworker, but i wanted a small set of chisels that were better than the off-brand from a big box store. after i gave them a sharpening with my DMT diamond plates, they work for me. Are there better chisels out there? i'm sure there are. are there worse ones? yes, i have some of them too. these have worked on cherry and maple so far, and i'm pleased with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Chris L

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tools
customer_reviews.text: These are beautifully crafted tools that make a woodworker proud to show them off. The cutting ends are very sharp and nicely shaped for efficient cuts. They hold and edge even in hardwood, and their considerable heft makes them comfortable to use. They do, of course, require some initial sharpening to remove the protective coating applied by the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Jim B.

customer_reviews.title: Just OK
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a chisel guy I just wanted a decent chisel set, for a project I was doing. However, I don't think the edge held up as well as I expected it to, maybe that's as good as it gets. I had to hone the edge quite often, and I was using them on pine only. They seem well made and I got a great edge on the chisel using a hone guide and sandpaper.
customer_reviews.author: James L. Smoak

customer_reviews.title: Great Chisels for the money.
customer_reviews.text: These Chisels where almost perfectly flat and after a little prepping with my Diamond plates and strop they are now razor sharp. These chisels were fairly sharp out of the box but now they are super sharp. I used Acetone to remove the thin layer of protectant that was on the metal but beware it will take off the stamped on Narex name and size of each chisel. I am very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: BIGA 1969

customer_reviews.title: Excellent once set up!
customer_reviews.text: I really like these chisels, especially for the price. Like most chisels they take some set-up work, particularly in lapping the back to be completely flat. Once done, they really hold an edge well. I recently chopped out some mortises in a 4.25 inch workbench top, and was really impressed with the way these performed. The handles aren't as good as on high end chisels, but who cares? got 4 chisels for the price of one "high quality" one!
customer_reviews.author: Bubbax300

customer_reviews.title: Wow, Money Well Spent!
customer_reviews.text: I was using some Stag chisels from Home Depot, but they really weren't suited to anything like fine woodworking. I upgraded to these and what a huge difference. First of all, they get much sharper and hold their edge very well. They're also a much better overall design, making them easier to handle. I just finished making my first set of dovetails with these chisels and I couldn't be happier. These are well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Yasumura

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the money
customer_reviews.text: I recently began woodworking as a hobby and I'm on a budget. I realized I needed some new chisels and tried these. I followed youtube advice and sharpened them on an old stone along with some sandpaper. Wow, I've never worked with really sharp chisels before, and these are wonderful. I'm pleased with the quality, and they seem to hold an edge really well. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: DirDick

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: Great chisels, especially for the price. The edge is pretty decent from the factory, but I honed them up on a fine stone and stropped the edges to get them where I wanted them for carving. There seems to be a thin, transparent coating of plastic or lacquer on the metal, probably to keep them from rusting during shipping and storage. Easily removed during sharpening.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Cote

customer_reviews.title: ... these and trying them out I am more than happy with them
customer_reviews.text: Upon receiving these and trying them out I am more than happy with them. Yes they do need sharpening but that is all part of the maintenance of any edged woodworking tool. The handles are said to be of beech but I cant really tell for sure. Whatever wood they are it is durable because I used a hickory mallet on them and there was no damage to the handles but I cant say the same for my mallet. They are also easy for me to pare with.Considering what other quality chisels cost you cant go wrong. These are second to none for their price in my humble opinion.
customer_reviews.author: ra

customer_reviews.title: good tool
customer_reviews.text: these came in today and within a few minutes I had the on the job. very sharp out of the box so before I messed with honing i decided to just use them. i was impressed , i put them to work immediately. just used on pine so far but I think the will continue to impress me on the oak.
customer_reviews.author: Larryd

customer_reviews.title: Awesome chisels
customer_reviews.text: Comparing these to a set of harbor freight chisels there is no competition. Mine came with very flat backs, and a good primary bevel. All I did was remove the grease they shipped with and polished up the secondary bevel using 600, 1000, 5000 stones. Once done they wasted large amounts with minimal effort and took nice thin trimmings.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Great Starter Chisel Set
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these a few months ago for a project that never got off the ground. I finally had a reason to crack them open for a small carving project for my wedding. The work was not super intricate or difficult but the chisels were sharp and easy to handle. The blade edge was straight, and they had a great feel in the hand. Really liked this set of chisels!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Good, accurate, basic starter set.
customer_reviews.text: Took me 3 hours to set them up with a honing guide to 25°/30°. Beautiful starterset. Metal is fairly hard and I’ve now used them for 3 weeks with minimal maintenance and no issues on mahogany, redwood, pine, and maple. The maple was last and they need a little sharpening now, but have held up really well.
customer_reviews.author: Niel

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I'm quite pleased with this chisel set so far. I've been using them mostly for dovetail preparation. I ended up also purchasing a 1/8" chisel for this purpose. They were pretty flat out of the box, and sharpen easily. Nice balance, and a pleasure to use. Hold their edge fairly well.
customer_reviews.author: Andy S

customer_reviews.title: nice beginner chisel; very soft
customer_reviews.text: Totally agreed with some earlier comments - these chisels are good for beginner, nice and affordable; but very soft. For really soft wood like pine/fir, they can do very well; walnut/mahogany/cherry, maybe; oak/beech, not able to keep up for even one small mortise. Same for mortise chisels. Same for the premium version. I also have a set of Irwin marples, those are a bit harder than these. I really don't like their ugly handles(plastic, round, never stop rolling) so I still keep using my Narex chisels.
customer_reviews.author: Kick

customer_reviews.title: Look and feel great
customer_reviews.text: They feel good in the hand and seem to be working exactly as advertised. I only just received mine so the true test will be how long they remain sharp and how they stand up to being sharpened. I'll have to update this, then.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Great set of wood chissels
customer_reviews.text: This is a great set, it is not ultra cheap but still great value. I'm a hobbyist, no expert at all but those make quick work of wood and stay sharp. It is relatively easy to make them literally razor sharp. Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Sbob

customer_reviews.title: Mostly flat and really great value
customer_reviews.text: Considering the price and the quality i'm very happy with the product. They need a very little flattening on the back which is nice not having to spend an hour flattening brand new chisels. Other than that they feel good in the hand and over all feel like high quality build.
customer_reviews.author: This guy

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: I'm a amateur woodworker and they are perfect. I can't tell you the difference between the more expensive one but I can tell you they feel a lot better in the hand than other ones at that price range. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Champagne

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable handles
customer_reviews.text: These chisels seem to be well made. I really like the feel of the handle. I spent about an hour flattening the backs and putting a sharp edge on them. The backs were already very close to being flat so I didn’t have to spend a lot of time on them.
customer_reviews.author: Cmanager

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and good value
customer_reviews.text: I'm a hobbyist woodworker on a budget, so every purchase I make is researched and needs to represent value. I try to get the best tools I can get with the money I have available. These chisels satisfy that philosophy nicely. They're machined very well and made from high quality materials. Obviously, these are not uber-high-end chisels like those you can get from Lie-Nelson, but they are better than any Stanley or Craftsman I've ever used, and they're better than the Chinese-made Marples/Irwins. They hold an edge well and are easy to sharpen if you use a honing jig.
customer_reviews.author: Cary C. Dunlap

customer_reviews.title: New Favorite Chisels!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely awesome! Can't wait to convert all my chisels and rasps to Narex. Was using the 750 Sweethearts but these seem to hold an edge better and personally more comfortable in my hand. Can't wait to complete my sets.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Narez chisel set
customer_reviews.text: Nice well made chisels. It took me 2 hours to sharpen them. the backs were pretty flat but the bevel needed lots of work. Once sharpened they should be good for years. There long enough for deep mortises. Would buy again. Great value for money.
customer_reviews.author: Michael E

customer_reviews.title: It's a great great of chisels for the price
customer_reviews.text: It's a great great of chisels for the price. Yes, you can find way better chisels which are made from stronger steel, which will remain sharper for longer time, hand made, etc, etc. However, if you are a casual user of chisels, and need them from time to time for a project -- they are great. Make sure you get a water stone and learn how to keep them sharp. I sharpen them every time I use them. Sharpen the bevel on a 1000 grit stone that was soaked in water, then polish the bevel and the back on a 6000 grit wet stone. Shouldn't take more than a few minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Yuval Tal

customer_reviews.title: Don't Cut Yourself
customer_reviews.text: These guys are really sharp on arrival. I haven't had to sharpen them yet, though I've been using them for a while now. The blades are long so you should be able to keep sharpening and using them for a lifetime. They come with some protective goo that wears off with a little use. The handles don't show use, in part because I only hit them with a wooden mallet.
customer_reviews.author: C. McGee

customer_reviews.title: Nice set, seems very well made.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife to use for carving a tree stump. She really liked it and thought the tools were well made.
customer_reviews.author: Steve J.

customer_reviews.title: I had to do a ridiculous amount of work on ...
customer_reviews.text: I had to do a ridiculous amount of work on them to both flatten and polish the "bellied" backs. Don't buy these unless you're willing to invest a lot of time in preparing them first.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Mac

customer_reviews.title: Great craftsmanship, back needed flattening
customer_reviews.text: Chistes required flattening of the back and beveling of the edge. These have worked great love the handle and steel. Edge was true to measure thin enough and very functional. Would buy again if I needed but these should last a very long time in my woodshop
customer_reviews.author: Mike M.

customer_reviews.title: fabulous
customer_reviews.text: These are very nice. The nicest I have ever had, which is not saying anything really. They are sharp. Coming from the harbor freight flavor, these are just wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Amy West

customer_reviews.title: Flat - ABSOLUTELY FLAT!
customer_reviews.text: The backs of these chisels are so close to flat it is amazing. it appears they are made correctly, machining and sharpening after heat treating to remove all distortion made during that heat and cool cycle. The result is you spend more time using the chisel than you do sharpening it and holding the back. These chisels are worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: tallndn

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for price
customer_reviews.text: They do take a little work to get in shape, but that is true with most all chisels. Good size handles for those with larger hands. They hold an edge well, and are better than most other value chisels I’ve used. I will update the review after I’ve used them longer.
customer_reviews.author: 1IDVet

customer_reviews.title: They do the job.
customer_reviews.text: They aren't the most balanced or made from the finest of steel, but they hold an edge adequately, and allow me to get the job done. Like all chisels, they need to be very sharp to work correctly. These don't take long to touch up the edge, but seem to need touching up a bit more often than some.
customer_reviews.author: Britt Salter

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: The steel in these chisels is great. they required no sharpening or prep prior to use except to remove plastic from the edge. I would recommend these chisels to any serious wood worker.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Anderson

customer_reviews.title: worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Well made, a tool snob might not like them, but they are a good value and way better than any I got from discount places.
customer_reviews.author: hairy_1

customer_reviews.title: Way better the box store chisels and a good price
customer_reviews.text: The seen like great quality steel. I have honed then and ready to use. I will update in a few months
customer_reviews.author: jeff shantar

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy Aldi. Just get these imo
customer_reviews.text: The metal is a little softer than I'd prefer but they get beyond razor sharp. They are 10x better than the Paul sellers recommended Aldi chisels. I like Narex as a brand.
customer_reviews.author: James A

customer_reviews.title: Nice tools
customer_reviews.text: I have not had a chance to flatten them so I haven't used them yet. They appear to be good quality and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these for about 3 months now, and so far, no real complaints. They are comfortable in the hand and feel substantial while not being heavy. They hold an edge pretty well, too. I'm happy with them, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: JBlair

customer_reviews.title: Great Chisel Set!
customer_reviews.text: These are my first full set of chisels and I really like them. After years of cheap home depot chisels, these things cut wood like butter. They come sharp and hold their edge rather well. Super happy that I added these to my workshop.
customer_reviews.author: rethomas

customer_reviews.title: Solid chisels overall
customer_reviews.text: Had them for four years already. Very pleased with the quality overall, tough build no chipping, cracking, dent, etc. A bit rough around the edges but nothing that cannot be easily fixed. These are, by far, best bang for your buck. Would 100% recommend. I later went ahead and bought the rasp set and 12 piece premium chisel set from Narex as well.
customer_reviews.author: kol257

customer_reviews.title: great chisels
customer_reviews.text: These seem to be very well made chisels. I bought these after doing a bit of research on the web and reading recommendations from Paul Sellers and the like. I'm new to wood working, but these took to a quick re-profiling very easily and the edges are scary sharp. They have been working very well for me. I definitely recommend them and will buy more products from the company in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: I really like them. The steel is high grade and will ...
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp and very well made. I really like them. The steel is high grade and will hold a sharpness for a long time . That is important when you are working and time is essential . It really hinder's thing's when you have to stop and sharpen up your tool's. I have seen people fired for such thing's . I always keep a second set of tool's handy just in case this happen's. Thank's for a quality set .
customer_reviews.author: Old Timer

customer_reviews.title: Arrived dull
customer_reviews.text: Came in the box full, barely had any edge to them at all. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great to get started.
customer_reviews.text: Great chisels. Good quality steel, good handles. It needs to be noted that you will need to do a lot of work to get them flat, if you dont have a good set of stones consider them in your purchase along with these.
customer_reviews.author: Garett Kytle

customer_reviews.title: Seriously amazing, Great value
customer_reviews.text: I took an hour to flatten the backs, sharpen, and hone all four through 3 grits as soon as I got them. The backs were pretty much dead flat required almost no effort. They have been holding their edge very well through poplar and oak. I'm working on a project with sapele now but have yet to use them on that. Long story short, I really enjoy using them and they do a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Lyle

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Steel !
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely happy with my set of Narex wood chisels. The removal of the shipping lacquer on the blades was easy enough and it only took about 20 minutes to bring all 4 cutting edges to razor sharpness by hand. I am amazed at how well these chisels hold an edge, even after cutting out mortises in hickory. I expect this will be the last set of wood chisels I ever need to buy. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: William K. Wainscott

customer_reviews.title: very sharp and well made
customer_reviews.text: i use it for my wood work and they are very sharp and well made, better than my Stanley's.
customer_reviews.author: NKM

customer_reviews.title: i love this set of chisels
customer_reviews.text: i love this set of chisels. Narex chisels are the best chisel that won't cost you an arm and a leg, and they have wood handles not plastic. They are real easy to sharpen and you get a super sharp edge that lasts a while. From now on i am only buying Narex brand chisels. If you are on a budget and want a set of good nice chisels buy this set.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Sharp beauty
customer_reviews.text: I can't say much because I'm pretty new to carpentry or woodworking. But these chisels are sharp even before polishing. The workmanship is also very beautiful and the finish is so fine. I just love it.
customer_reviews.author: Terence Cheah

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: My first chisels. Seem to be of great quality. I also bought some cheaper ones of lesser quality. When holding side by side, you can tell the difference.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Flemon

customer_reviews.title: Great starter chisels
customer_reviews.text: My first set of chisels, very good for the price. Easy to sharpen and they seem to stay sharp for quite some time. The handles are a little bulky but some people might prefer this. Flattened the back easily and got to work quick, a good buy
customer_reviews.author: R. S. Hamblin

customer_reviews.title: Decent chisels for a good price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great set for a decent price. I’d buy again. They came with a good edge, and I haven’t had to resharpen yet.
customer_reviews.author: optimystik1

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to avoid beating up my Stanley Sweethearts, but they are becoming my go-tos for daily work. Be aware that the set is metric, so the Imperial equivalents in the specs are just a little off.
customer_reviews.author: Lupo

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent set of chisels
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent set of chisels. Mine did need sharpening right out of the box. Oh, they were sharp enough for some wood but I work a lot with hard Maple and need my chisels very sharp. Once sharpened, these hold an edge well.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Came in pretty sharp, keeps a good edge, easy to sharpen. The handles feel good. I have nothing to complain about.
customer_reviews.author: Gallani Guillaume

customer_reviews.title: An excellent choice for most woodworkers
customer_reviews.text: I would say these are excellent but I figured for the money they wouldn’t break I have actually broke the smaller chisel twice! Overall I would recommend because I am very hard on my tools.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Michels

customer_reviews.title: Great out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box, sharper than anything...I'm sure it's possible to improve the edge but for 99% of what I'll do, they're fine.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Initial inspection
customer_reviews.text: Not quite flat, indented above the blade edge, doesnt say narex on handle. I will update after use.
customer_reviews.author: joshua cox

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Arrived almost ready to use, a quick check that the backs were flat and a fast honing and they were all ready, less than 10 minutes including opening the package.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Swineford

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Money!
customer_reviews.text: Worth every cent. Well made and very sturdy. I would recomend getting a good sharpener to aid in sharping upon purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mary M

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality. You can feel it right out of ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality. You can feel it right out of the box. Probably my grandchildren will be able to use it in a far future.
customer_reviews.author: Rubigno

customer_reviews.title: Well made chisels
customer_reviews.text: The blades are made from high quality steel and hold an edge well after normal tuning.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer Bill

customer_reviews.title: After flattening the backs a little bit and giving them a really nice polished edge on the bevel side
customer_reviews.text: My first set of chisels. After flattening the backs a little bit and giving them a really nice polished edge on the bevel side, they hold that edge very well from what I've done so far. One issue I had was I kept cutting my fingers along the sides of them, but I took that edge down a hair and no more cuts.Definitely would buy again, but I doubt I'll need to.
customer_reviews.author: This Is Me

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: Good set at a good price. Not the sharpest so need to be honed before any real woodworking, but for that price. Pretty sweet.
customer_reviews.author: D. Vernor

customer_reviews.title: Great value for quality chisels
customer_reviews.text: For a relatively inexpensive set of chisels, these are excellent quality. I use them for dovetail and mortise and tendon joinery, and they hold a sharpening well and have bevels that come to a narrow edge. (Key for dovetailing)
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Brown

customer_reviews.title: good quality at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Four chisel set seem of exceptional quality for the price. For fine woodworking you will need to sharpen correctly. After that they appear they will last as long as you maintain your edge properly. Even a high end overpriced chisel will need sharpening and maintenance. As for quality I am very pleased and recommend these can't be beat for a good set at a great price
customer_reviews.author: RV Habit

customer_reviews.title: As described
customer_reviews.text: A leading woodworking magazine rated these a "Best Buy" of chisels. As expected and fast delivery!
customer_reviews.author: CD TOM

customer_reviews.title: Quality plus
customer_reviews.text: This is not the typical Chinese tools. Well made and excellent quality.
customer_reviews.author: alan hall

customer_reviews.title: Nicely made and easy to maintain sharpness
customer_reviews.text: Love these Check made chisels. Great price for the value and they stay sharp for almost ever :) Easy to keep sharp. Great for hardwood (90% of my projects are hardwood) use as well. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Big Buddha

customer_reviews.title: A Great Set of Chisels!
customer_reviews.text: I took my time and shopped a lot of chisels to find exactly what I wanted, but I kept coming back to this set. The balance between the handle and tip is nice, the blades are solid and can be well honed. I'm impressed with the quality of these tools with a price that didn't break my budget.
customer_reviews.author: Cdunc

customer_reviews.title: My favorite chisels!
customer_reviews.text: The best chisels for the price. They perform just as good as the more expensive brands. Once you hone them up they’re great!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Peppeard

customer_reviews.title: Package doesn't  fully enclose the chisels
customer_reviews.text: The cardboard has some shallow spot to display the chisels. The enclosure of the package is a thin plastic film. But there's a tear on the it, which exposes the chisels to the outside air. As I'm not going to use it right away, my concern is if the chisels could be rusty after a while.
customer_reviews.author: Jwo-Luen Shieh

customer_reviews.title: One of the best entry level set available
customer_reviews.text: One of the best entry level set available. They hold an edge that can be used to shave after using them all day. Don't waste your time buying anything comparable in price because you will be upset with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great craftsmanship
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful piece of fine craftsmanship. I love the wood handles compared to my Marples Blue Chip chisels with their rubber handles. Damn sharp out of the box, a 1000 grit and 3000 grit for the secondary bevel and they cut like butter through hard rock maple. These are my new favorite western style chisels.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Matley

customer_reviews.title: Work as described
customer_reviews.text: Solid set of Chisiels. Fairly easy to flatten the backs, plan on spending some time the first time you sharpen.
customer_reviews.author: A capitalist consumer

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: These chisels showed up quickly and were pretty sharp out of the box. Only a light touch was required to get to cut through anything. They feel good in the hand, too.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the price
customer_reviews.text: These chisels are a great buy for the price. This whole set is cheaper than one Lie Nielsen chisel. They are not as high quality as Lie Nielsen (what is?), but they are durable and sharpen up beautifully with a proper waterstone set. They are clearly made to last.
customer_reviews.author: Adriana V.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice quality chisels for the price!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful as a chisel can be. Nice quality. Will fit the bill for dovetails!!!
customer_reviews.author: Natalia

customer_reviews.title: Great chisels
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic chisels - and really easy to get razor sharp.
customer_reviews.author: The Man

customer_reviews.title: good chisels
customer_reviews.text: Needed sharpening out of the box but you can tell these are sturdy, well built tools. Happy with the purchase. They're also bigger than I thought.
customer_reviews.author: komelon

customer_reviews.title: Narex, a name you need to know.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality tools. Better finish than other brands I've owned, built very robust Have been using installing hardwood flooring. Cuts oak cleanly.Very pleased , best I've owned. Handles fit my hand well and built to take mallet blows with metal band at top. Looking forward to years of service.
customer_reviews.author: John M. Roberts,Jr

customer_reviews.title: An amazing chisel set at a great value!
customer_reviews.text: An amazing chisel set at a great value! I had read several reviews of wood chisel sets while researching online, and I can see why yours consistently is mentioned as a top choice! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Squires

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product. I touched them up when they arrived ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product.I touched them up when they arrived and they are razor sharp. First set of chisels I could shave with.
customer_reviews.author: Dave B.

customer_reviews.title: Sharp and Solid
customer_reviews.text: These come very sharp. They require very little sharpening out of the box and are quite well built. I used these to install a door handle and it worked amazingly.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce Deneen

customer_reviews.title: Chisel arrived very sharp, and in a timely manner ...
customer_reviews.text: Chisel arrived very sharp, and in a timely manner. Looking forward to using them with my next project. These are a quality product for reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl L. Beaulieu

customer_reviews.title: Can't do better for the money
customer_reviews.text: You can't do better for the money. I do lots of fine woodworking and chisel work. These are just as good of not better than my sweetheart chisels
customer_reviews.author: Troy Meyer

customer_reviews.title: My woodworker loves them
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my woodworker as a just because gift... he loves them! The shipping was super fast, they arrived a day early (it was perfect I got to see him open them)
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Chisels
customer_reviews.text: Started with a set of cheaper crappy chisels, after a year or so I decided to upgrade. I’ve read good things about the Narex. They have been great and are holding up well.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Brownlee

customer_reviews.title: Solid, razor-sharp chisels
customer_reviews.text: I'm a novice woodworker and this is the first set of chisels I've ever owned, but I'm very happy with them so far. I've had them for a few months now. They're really solid and appear to be very well made. Oh, yeah, and they're sharp as sh*t! Very easy to handle and maneuver precisely to remove the material you need.
customer_reviews.author: diz

customer_reviews.title: Work great!
customer_reviews.text: Takes a little while to sharpen but once I got them sharpened they work great!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Tapia

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Great chisels, and plenty sharp right out of the box. I used them to mortise a 4x4, and they cut through like butter. Excellent product with an excellent price.
customer_reviews.author: aarellano

customer_reviews.title: Good value.
customer_reviews.text: These are good solid chisels. Take an edge and hold it. Comfortable handle. Well made product.
customer_reviews.author: Steven A. Robinson

product_meta.title: Narex (Made in Czech Republic) 4 pc set 6mm (1/4"), 12 (1/2"), 20 (3/4") , 26 (1 1/16") mm Woodworking Chisels 863010
product_meta.description: These chisels are made by a small tool manufacturer in the Czech Republic and are of exceptional quality. The blades are made from fine-grained, nicely tempered chrome-manganese steel and hardened to Rc 59. The blades take and hold an excellent edge. The blades are accurately ground and have a slimmer cross section that woodworkers prefer. As with all edge tool, they'll need sharpening before use. These chisels are an excellent value in a good quality tool. This is a 4 piece set contains the following sizes: 6 mm (1/4"), 12 mm (1/2"), 20 mm (13/16") and 26 mm (1 1/32"). They are ground at a 25 degree bevel. Blades are 4 3/4" to 5 1/2" long. Handles are lacquered European Beech are 5 1/2” long. Overall sizes range in length from 10 1/8" to 11". Blades have well-seated heavy steel tangs and handles have 2 ferrules to withstand vigorous mallet work. They come in a shrink wrapped retail box.
feature_bullets: Made by a small tool manufacturer in the Czech Republic
Blades are made from fine-grained, nicely tempered chrome-manganese steel and hardened to Rc 59
Contains the following sizes: 6 mm (1/4"), 12 mm (1/2"), 20 mm (13/16") and 26 mm (1 1/32")
Bevel ground at a 25 degree bevel.
Handles made from laquered European Beechwood
